Parsnip Survival Model Wrappers

Source: R/jparsnipsurvival.h.R
jparsnipsurvival.Rd

Unified interface to survival models using the parsnip package and tidymodels framework. Supports multiple survival model engines with standardized syntax for model fitting, prediction, and evaluation.

Usage

jparsnipsurvival(
  data,
  time_var,
  event_var,
  predictors,
  model_engine = "cox_survival",
  parametric_dist = "weibull",
  prediction_type = "linear_pred",
  penalty = 0.01,
  mixture = 1,
  trees = 500,
  min_n = 10,
  split_data = FALSE,
  train_prop = 0.8,
  cross_validation = FALSE,
  cv_folds = 5,
  bootstrap_resamples = 100,
  show_predictions = TRUE,
  show_metrics = TRUE,
  show_coefficients = TRUE,
  show_residuals = FALSE,
  confidence_level = 0.95
)

Arguments

data

Dataset for survival modeling

time_var

Survival time or time to event variable

event_var

Event indicator (0=censored, 1=event)

predictors

Variables to include in the survival model

model_engine

Survival model engine to use

parametric_dist

Distribution for parametric survival models

prediction_type

Type of prediction to generate

penalty

L1/L2 penalty parameter for regularized models

mixture

Elastic net mixing parameter (0=ridge, 1=lasso)

trees

Number of trees for random forest models

min_n

Minimum number of observations in terminal nodes

split_data

Split data into training and testing sets

train_prop

Proportion of data to use for training

cross_validation

Perform cross-validation for model assessment

cv_folds

Number of cross-validation folds

bootstrap_resamples

Number of bootstrap resamples for uncertainty estimation

show_predictions

Display model predictions

show_metrics

Display model performance metrics

show_coefficients

Display model coefficients and statistics

show_residuals

Display residual plots and diagnostics

confidence_level

Confidence level for intervals

Value

A results object containing:

results$instructionsa html
results$model_infoa table
results$coefficientsa table
results$predictionsa table
results$performance_metricsa table
results$cross_validation_resultsa table
results$variable_importancea table
results$survival_curvesan image
results$residual_plotsan image
results$model_summarya html
results$interpretationa html

Tables can be converted to data frames with asDF or as.data.frame. For example:

results$model_info$asDF

as.data.frame(results$model_info)
